Name of Library or Collection: London Metropolitan University Library Special Collections
Address, including postcode: The Wash Houses, 25 Old Castle Street,London,E1 7NT
Notes on coverage combined: Trade Union and communtiy history with focus on London. TUC Library is housed here, London Trades Council minutes 1860 - 1970; London Bookbinders and Paperworkers.  London Met Collections include: Archive of the Irish in Britain; Community Media Collection (community radio and TV in UK); East End Archive (artists); E & A Wates Archive (East London business.)

Address, including postcode: The Queen's College, High Street, Oxford, OX1 4AW
Notes on coverage combined: The Bridgewater Collection: over 200 rare bibliographic items related to Cumberland and Westmorland, c. 1700-current.  The College has a historic collection with the area.  A large and important collection of heraldic visitation MSS related to various parts of England, collected and copied in the C16th and 17th.

Address, including postcode: All Saints Library,Manchester,M15 6BH
Notes on coverage combined: Greater Manchester-related books, journals, pamphlets, ephemera, parish register transcripts and more, plus a 'Manchester Bibliography' card index of mainly articles, related to Manchester history from c.1975-1995. Also home to the North West Film Archive.

Name of Library or Collection: HADAS - Hendon and District Archaeological Society

Name of Library or Collection: Museum of the Order of St John
Address, including postcode: The Museum of the Order of St John, St John’s Gate, St John’s Lane,Clerkenwell, London, EC1M 4DA
Notes on coverage combined: The Museum of the Order of St John holds museum, library and archive collections relating to the Order of St John and St John's Ambulance. Material on Clerkenwell Priory is relevant to the history of London.

Address, including postcode: Senate House Library,University of London,Malet Street,London,WC1E 7HU
Notes on coverage combined: Senate House Library has strong print and electronic collections of resources about British history, covering all regions of the UK.  Our research collections include academic monographs and journals but also more unusual materials such as pamphlets or the output of small press publishers. We also hold a series of local history journals covering most regions of the UK.
